intro: Strobilanthes paniculiformis, commonly known as the paniculate strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, branched inflorescences. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural collections.
